abstract.t: Today, with the rapid rise of home networking, there is a need forsimple mechanisms of IPv4 address allocation and name resolution. Thisdocument describes the behavior of the mini-DHCP server, a small scaleDHCP server that is typically implemented as part of a home gateway.As described in this document, the mini-DHCP server is capable ofallocating addresses either in single or multi-segment networks. Itsupports dynamic DNS, and is capable of automatically detecting thepresence of a full-fledged DHCP server, or other mini-DHCP servers, andshutting down as required.
